availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Lexington City Council
Regular Meeting
November 2d 1865

Councilman B. G. Bruce presented a petition from James Lyon's praying the remission of a fine of $60 & costs inflicted upon him by the Lexington City Court for Selling liquor without license -- The remission of said fine not being within the jurisdiction of the Council, on motion of Mr B G Bruce said petition was unanimously refered to His Excellency the Governor recommending the remission of said fine --
A true copy of the records of the Mayors Board of Councilmen of Lexington as passed November 2d 1865 relative to the fine of said Lyons

Att G. Stoll Jr
Clerk of the Council
